Class Temperature

  • java.lang.Object
    • Temperature
  • public class Temperature
extends java.lang.Object

    Temperature.java - Contains methods that will be utilized in ConversionTester.java class

    Instance variables:

    • degrees (double) - number of degrees in this temperature
    • scale (char) - 'C' = Celsius, 'F' = Fahrenheit
    Version:
    Module 7 Homework Project 3
    Author:
    Will Bouasisavath

    • Constructor Detail

      • Temperature

        public Temperature()
        Constructor w/o a parameter sets degrees to 0 and scale to 'C'

      • Temperature

        public Temperature​(double degrees)
        Constructor with one parameter
        Parameters:
        degrees - is used to set this.degrees to, and scale is set to 'C' again

      • Temperature

        public Temperature​(char scale)
        Constructor with one parameter
        Parameters:
        scale - is used to set scale to either 'C' or 'F', and degrees is set to 0

      • setTemperatureAndScale

        public void setTemperatureAndScale​(double degrees,
                                   char scale)
        Setter for degrees and scale
        Parameters:
        degrees - will be utilized in a setDegrees() method
        scale - will be utilized in a setScale() method

      • getFahrenheit

        public double getFahrenheit()
        Method that returns a fahrenheit value of the temperature
        Returns:
        degrees if scale is already 'F'. Otherwise, return Math.Round to round to 2 decimal places with degrees as the 'C' in the formula F = 9/5 C + 32 for all other cases

      • getCelsius

        public double getCelsius()
        Method that returns a celsius value of the temperature
        Returns:
        degrees if scale is already 'C', otherwise return the Math.Round to round to 2 decimal places with degrees as the 'F' in the formula C = 9/5 ( F - 32 )

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(Temperature another)
        Parameters:
        another - is another Temperature object
        Returns:
        true if both of the celsius values are equal, otherwise return false

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        A method that returns a string with a Temperature object's relevant data presented in proper format
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String that displays the degree value rounded to one decimal place, along with a degree symbol, and the scale value ('C' or 'F')
